is a small village south of Cebu on

. It has recently started blossoming into a tourist stop due to whale sharks that swim close to the coast. This tourist attraction is somewhat controversial due to the fact that fisherman lure them into the coast by feeding them. It is left to the reader to decide if they want to support this.
every hour, a short bus ride from
. From here it is a 15 minute drive either by moto, rickshaw or bus.

value: Go see Tumalog falls a cascading waterfall, is 15 minutes drive away. Ask someone in the village to take you there. Entrance fee is 20 pesos.

At time of writing there is not that much to do apart from snorkelling or diving with the whale sharks. This occurs between 6.30 and midday and in August 2013 was 1000 pesos. As a result many visit here for a day trip from

Aaron's guesthouse resort has small huts for 1200-1500 pesos right on the beach. They also have food. Their tuna steak was one of the best I've ever had and a bargain at 130 pesos.
